thread.title: The Dinner That Changed the Investing World

author: Ben Eisen
title: The Dinner That Changed the Investing World
text:
As the first U.S. exchange-traded fund was being launched 25 years ago, the fund’s backers gathered for a casual dinner on the 10th floor of the American Stock Exchange’s art deco downtown headquarters. Ivers Riley, an exchange executive, made opening remarks to the small crowd.
Leadership from Amex and its partners at trading firm Spear Leeds & Kellogg LP and custodial bank State Street Corp. hoped that selling the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY)—a fund that traded like a security and conferred a way to reap the share-price... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
